name: Calling Dr. "Luke" Quiz | New Testament | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the first word of Luke in the King James Version?
questions.explanation:
Forasmuch.

	It says in Luke 1:1, "Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among us." Forasmuch is an old fashioned word and it means since.

questions.text: How many times did the devil tempt Jesus in chapter 4?
questions.explanation:
3.

	The first time he tempted Jesus to turn the stone into bread (Luke 4:3), the second time he tempted Jesus to bow down to him and gain the world (Luke 4:6-7), and the third time he tempted Jesus to jump off the roof of the building and be caught by angels (Luke 4:9). Jesus resisted temptation all three times.

questions.text: What should you do before removing the mote out of your brother's eye, according to chapter 6?
questions.correct: Cast out first the beam of thine own eye
options: Pray for God's hands to guide you
Charge him at least five hundred shekels
questions.explanation:
Cast out first the beam of thine own eye.

	It says in Luke 6:42, "Either how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, let me pull out the mote that is in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in thine own eye? Thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine own eye, and then shalt thou see clearly to pull out the mote that is in thy brother's eye." Basically what this verse is saying is before you condemn someone else, you should take a look at yourself because you have your own problems and faults and therefore are not fit to judge anyone else.

questions.text: Who does Jesus say is the greatest prophet?
questions.explanation:
John the Baptist.

	It says in Luke 7:28, "For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he." John the Baptist and Jesus were cousins because their mothers, Mary and Elizabeth, were cousins.

questions.text: In chapter 12 (KJV) what does Jesus say God values us (humans) more than?
questions.explanation:
sparrows.

	It says in Luke 12:7, "But even the very hairs of your head are all numbered. Fear not therefore: ye are of more value than many sparrows." Earlier it says that God does not forget any of the sparrows (see Luke 12:6) meaning that if God cares that much about the sparrows and he cares more for human beings, then He clearly loves humans a lot.

questions.text: What does Luke 14:2 (KJV) say the man had?
questions.explanation:
dropsy.

	It says in Luke 14:2, "And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy."  Dropsy is when the body has too much fluid built up, causing congestive heart failure.

questions.text: How many of the 10 lepers thanked Jesus for healing them?
questions.explanation:
1.

	It says in Luke 17:15, "And one of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back, and with a loud voice glorified God." This example shows that people do not always have gratitude even for very good works.

questions.text: What does Luke 22:44 say Jesus's sweat was like?
questions.explanation:
drops of blood.

	It says in Luke 22:44, "And being in an agony he prayed more earnestly: and his sweat was as it were great drops of blood falling down to the ground."  There seems to be a discrepancy among Bible scholars. Some believe "as it were great drops of blood" means he was just sweating a lot because he knew what was going to happen. Others say that Jesus had hematohidrosis, which is a medical condition where your capillaries burst, usually set on by great stress.

questions.text: What were the crowds yelling in Luke 23:21 (KJV)?
options: You da Man! You da Son of Man!
questions.explanation:
Crucify Him, crucify Him!.

	It says in Luke 23:21, "But they cried, saying, Crucify him, crucify him." Pilate actually seemed to feared Jesus because Jesus had such a strong group of followers and tried to talk the crowds into only flogging Jesus, but they wouldn't hear it, they wanted Him crucified.

questions.text: After Jesus rose and spoke to His disciples, what city was He in when He went up to Heaven?
questions.explanation:
Bethany.

	It says in Luke 24:50-51, "And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them. And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven." Bethany was located in the present day al-Eizariya, about 1.5 miles east of Jerusalem.
